data.enText: a light with a single, very bright beam that can be directed at a particular place or person
The room was lit by spotlights.

data.chText: 聚光灯照亮的地方；聚光灯照明圈
data.enText: the area of light that is made by a spotlight

data.chText: 她独自站在舞台的聚光灯下。
data.enText: She stood alone on stage in the spotlight.
attention from newspapers, television and the public

data.chText: 失业问题再次受到人们的关注。
data.enText: Unemployment is once again in the spotlight .

data.chText: 等议会重开的时候，这个问题将成为焦点。
data.enText: The issue will come under the spotlight when parliament reassembles.

data.chText: 这篇报道使人们将关注的目光投向街头犯罪激增的问题。
data.enText: The report has turned the spotlight on the startling rise in street crime.

data.text: Especially in sense 2, spotlighted is also used for the past tense and past participle.
第2义的过去式和过去分词也可用spotlighted。

data.enText: to shine a spotlight on sb/sth

data.chText: 特别关注，突出报道（以使公众注意）
data.enText: to give special attention to a problem, situation, etc. so that people notice it

data.chText: 节目突出报道了公共医疗机构的财政问题。
data.enText: The programme spotlights financial problems in the health service.

means: 特别关注，突出报道(以使公众注意)

tr: a lamp that produces a strong beam of light to illuminate a restricted area
used to focus attention of a stage performer

example: he enjoyed being in the limelight
when Congress investigates it brings the full glare of publicity to the agency

tr: illuminate with a spotlight, as in the theater
move into the foreground to make more visible or prominent
example: The introduction highlighted the speaker's distinguished career in linguistics

value.def: A spotlight is a powerful light, for example in a theatre, which can be directed so that it lights up a small area.
If something spotlights a particular problem or situation, it makes people notice it and think about it.

example.ex: The budget crisis also spotlighted a weakening American economy.
example.tran: 预算危机也突显了正在衰退的美国经济。
一本关注女企业家的新书

value.def: Someone or something that is in the spotlight is getting a great deal of public attention.

example.ex: Webb is back in the spotlight.

value.tran: 成为公众关注的焦点;受到瞩目

value.def: If someone or something comes under the spotlight, they are thoroughly examined, especially by journalists and the public.

example.ex: The economy will come under the spotlight today at the conference of the Trades Union Congress.
example.tran: 经济将会成为今天工会代表大会会议上的焦点。

value.tran: 备受(媒体和公众的)关注

trans: 成为公众关注的焦点;受到瞩目
备受(媒体和公众的)关注
